definition: to write comments on a report submitted by a subordinate/written comments from a superior
to ascertain/to act on/to criticize/to pass on/classifier for batches, lots, military flights/tier (for the ranking of universities and colleges)

sentences.english: A sketch of the long report by the budget committee was submitted to the mayor for approval.
sentences.chinese: 預算委員會的長篇報告的梗概已提交市長批示。

sentences.english: After succeeding in landing on George Island, the captain sent a radio message to the headquarters by radio.
sentences.chinese: 勝利登上喬治島後，船長向批示部發了一份無線電報。

sentences.english: It is useful to handle the compiler specific placement of the calling convention specifier .
sentences.chinese: 它用於處理編譯器的調用協定批示符的特殊位置。

sentences.english: Science is a commander whellole practice is a soldier.
sentences.chinese: 科學是批示官，實踐是兵士。

sentences.english: Napoleon was one of the greatest military commanders in history.
sentences.chinese: 拿破崙是最巨大地軍事批示官地汗青。

definition: to approve and forward/to endorse/stamp "approved for distribution"
to report to one's superiors/to appear in the news/to reply to a letter
Military Commission of the Communist Party Central Committee
memorial to the emperor (folded in accordion form)
secretary (chief official of a branch of a socialist or communist party)/clerk/scribe
red-letterhead document, an official document with the name of the issuing government agency printed in red at the top, circulated to relevant bodies
to reply officially to a subordinate
to report/to give an account of/to collect information and report back
